body: Hi, After the release of the HB[+] i started to do the obvious thing: compare the legacy results with the [+]. I'm testing the 00_point_in_time_gridbased.gh example and i'm having trouble with the climatebased sky component. For ALL weather files in my country i get 0 values. See below image: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/s7*oIGIKd8p4NLu-A*uE5li9yn1kZR0lAVhFn1iAPAp8dPO-s8oKNN4eWTtodQPgRUHqQwmYzUPjn6ht7hmpRhaWvEyG6sDk/Capture1.JPG)While the legacy produces the following: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/s7*oIGIKd8qPdTtEJ5f1rYKq8NI-AsU1rEgSjNaBPk42CPuu7HfV85suXfw0sw8KkkWKsEYf1gVN8BC03uHXHrylmPWnK2Yf/Capture.JPG)I suspect the issue can be with the WEA creator ([+] uses wea while Legacy uses epw). Visualizing the created sky i see it is completely black and seeing the globalHorIrradiance output of the watchTheSky it gives 0[+] and 995 [legacy]. Any ideas? Thanks, -A.
topic: HB[+] vs HB_Legacy - Weather file issues

replies.body:
Hi Abraham,

Sorry for the delayed reply. Can you confirm that it works fine with a US weather location? I opened an issue [here](https://github.com/ladybug-tools/honeybee/issues/181).

Mostapha

Hi Mostapha,

No worries.

Yes. This is something i checked right away (US weather files) and they work fine.

-A.
